attributes.action: In any EU exit related vote, MP’s MUST reflect their constituency EU Ref. votes.
attributes.additional_details: The EU Referendum was the largest turn out of the UK's electorate in decades, and the majority voted in favour of terminating our membership of the EU. MP's should respect, and reflect, the views of their constituents as this is why they are elected, NOT their own or party views on such an issue. Many MP's seem to believe they can ignore their constituents wishes, including my own who was elected into office with just over half the number of votes cast in favour of leaving the EU. They can not!
attributes.background: We, the undersigned, demand that should any future Parliamentary vote be called regarding the UK's exit from the EU that ALL MP's reflect the majority votes cast by their constituent's in the EU Referendum held 23rd June 2016, not their personal or party beliefs, or resign their position as MP.

rejection.details: It's the responsibility of individual MPs, not the Government or Parliament as a whole, to decide how to vote in the House of Commons.
